intro: Macroclinidium, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its milky sap is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
